Reference

Overview of the package

sars2pack-package

sars2pack: Easy access to and use of iconic COVID-19 data resource

Data resources

Data resources that are accessible from this package are somewhat arbitrarily divided into general groupings. For details of each dataset, click on the link. For an overview of data resources, see the Datasets vignette.

All data resources

Access (typically web-based) data resources related to COVID-19.

available_datasets() dataset_details()

list and detail available sars2pack datasets

apple_mobility_data()

Access Apple mobility data

beoutbreakprepared_data()

Individual-level data contributed from around the world

cdc_aggregated_projections()

Projected deaths from COVID-19 models

covidtracker_data()

US State-level data including test results

descartes_mobility_data()

Get US daily mobility data from Descartes Labs

ecdc_data()

Daily COVID-19 deaths and confirmed cases from the European CDC

eu_data_cache_data() eu_data_cache_datasets()

Country, region, and province level COVID-19 time series for Europe

google_mobility_data()

Google mobility dataset

government_policy_timeline()

Longitudinal tracking of government interventions to combat COVID-19

healthdata_projections_data()

healthdata.org covid19 morbidity and hospitalization estimates

jhu_data()

Global COVID-19 data from JHU CSSEGIS

jhu_us_data()

US counties COVID-19 data from JHU CSSEGIS

kff_icu_beds()

Kaiser Family Foundation US County-level ICU bed data

nytimes_county_data() nytimes_state_data()

United States county and state level data from the New York Times

us_county_geo_details()

United States county-level geographic details

us_healthcare_capacity()

United States healthcare system capacity by provider

us_state_distancing_policy()

United States social distancing policies for COVID-19

usa_facts_data()

United States state and county level data from USAFacts

Mobility data resources

Access datasets that provide insight into how much and where people are moving and how those metrics change over time.

apple_mobility_data()

Access Apple mobility data

descartes_mobility_data()

Get US daily mobility data from Descartes Labs

google_mobility_data()

Google mobility dataset

Additional functionality

Find any additional related to analysis, plotting, and data included with the package.

CRF_468_China

serial interval values fo 468 COVID-19 cases in 93 cities in China

column_summaries()

convenience function for summarizing data.frame columns

country_metadata()

Get basic country data

cumulative_events_ejhu()

constructor for covid_events

cumulative_events_nyt_state()

create cumulative_events instance for state data from NYT

datasets_to_sql()

Export all available datasets to SQL database

demo_simulation()

set up a simulation as demonstrated by John C Mallery

easyEG_eucache()

simplify production of EG fit using eu_data_cache_data

eesi()

demonstrative app for EpiEstim Rt sensitivity analysis

enriched_jhu_data()

Get enriched jhu dataset enriched with country-level metadata

estimate_R()

estimate R0

form_incident_events()

transform cumulative data to daily incidence

get_series()

supersimple series extraction

integer_to_fips() county_to_state_fips()

convert an integer to fips

jhu_data_to_excel()

Create +/- write excel format of enriched JHU global data

make_cumulative_events()

generic cumulative_events generator

mar19df

march 19 result of CSSEGISandData/COVID-19/ time series data retrieval as data.frame

mar19dt

march 19 result of CSSEGISandData/COVID-19/ time series data retrieval as data.table

plot(<covid_events>)

plot for covid_events

plot(<easyEG>)

plotter for easyEG run

plot2(<R0.sR>)

version of R0:::plot.R0.sR that does not use dev.new

plot2()

generic for simpler plotter for R0.sR

plot_epicurve()

Plot a (set of) epidemic curve(s)

plot_projection()

plot the disease course and death projections

plot_series()

supersimple series plotter

plotfit2(<R0.sR>)

version of R0:::plotfit.R0.sR that does not use dev.new

plotfit2()

generic for simpler plotter for plotfit for R0.sR

print(<covid_events>)

print for a covid_events instance

sars2pack-package

sars2pack: Easy access to and use of iconic COVID-19 data resource

si_cens_G

MCMC-based model for SI, Gamma family used for censored-data likelihood

si_cens_L

MCMC-based model for SI, lognormal family used for censored-data likelihood

si_cens_W

MCMC-based model for SI, Weibull family used for censored-data likelihood

si_pos_G

MCMC-based model for SI, Gamma family used for positive-data likelihood

si_pos_L

MCMC-based model for SI, lognormal family used for positive-data likelihood

si_pos_W

MCMC-based model for SI, Weibull family used for positive-data likelihood

trim_between()

trim part of series, generic

trim_between(<covid_events>)

focus on segment of series delimited by two dates

trim_from()

trim early part of series, generic

trim_from(<covid_events>)

trim early part of series

trim_leading_values()

trim leading repeats of a given value from a vector
